Class TCube

  • java.lang.Object
    • TCube
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Solvable

    public class TCube
extends java.lang.Object
implements Solvable
    The TCube class represents a 3x3x1 rubick's cube (floppy cube or troika cube). The configuration of the cube is given by a string/matrix representing the cube colors. Where zero represents, a non existing part of the cube. Example: GGG00000 WWWOYYYR WWWOYYYR WWWOYYYR BBB00000
    Since:
    10/12/2016
    Version:
    4.7
    Author:
    Andre Pedro, Ricardo Reais, Vasco Carvalho
    See Also:
    Solvable, Algorithm

      The char matrix cube, represents the color configuration of the floppy cube.
      private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> solutions
      The solutions list contains, all the cube available solutions.
      private int step
      The int step, represents the current step of the cube, when it trying to find the solution.
      private static java.util.ArrayList<Solvable> successors
      The successors list contains, every possible next move configuration.

    • Field Detail

      • cube

        private char[][] cube
        The char matrix cube, represents the color configuration of the floppy cube.

      • config

        private java.lang.String config
        The String config, represents the configuration of the floppy cube using a single line. The zeros represent non existent blocks. (Easier to read for the computer, harder to read for humans)

      • step

        private int step
        The int step, represents the current step of the cube, when it trying to find the solution.

      • solutions

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> solutions
        The solutions list contains, all the cube available solutions. (Rubick's cube solution)

      • successors

        private static java.util.ArrayList<Solvable> successors
        The successors list contains, every possible next move configuration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCube

        public TCube(java.lang.String config)
        The creation of a valid TCube implies that the initial configuration has exactly 40 characters. The constructor when not given a step number, assumes that the step is the first one (step zero).
        Parameters:
        config - Cube color configuration ("computer readable format")
        See Also:
        setCube(String, int)

      • TCube

        public TCube(java.lang.String config,
             int step)
        The creation of a valid TCube implies that the initial configuration has exactly 40 characters. The constructor when not given a step number, assumes that the step is the first one (step zero).
        Parameters:
        config - Cube color configuration ("computer readable format")
        step - Cube current step (zero for the first step)
        See Also:
        setCube(String, int)

    • Method Detail

      • initCube

        public void initCube()
        Allocates space for the cube color matrix.

      • setCube

        public void setCube(java.lang.String config,
                    int step)
        The creation of a valid TCube implies that the initial configuration has exactly 40 characters. The constructor when not given a step number, assumes that the step is the first one (step zero).
        Parameters:
        config - Cube color configuration ("computer readable format")
        step - Cube current step (zero for the first step)

      • getCube

        public char[][] getCube()
        Get current cube configuration in matrix of chars format. (Cube updates are done through cube moves)
        Returns:
        The matrix with the color configuration of the cube. (easier for humans and harder for computers).

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig(java.lang.String config)
        The creation of a valid TCube implies that the initial configuration has exactly 40 characters.
        Parameters:
        config - Cube color configuration ("computer readable format")

      • getConfig

        public java.lang.String getConfig()
        Get current cube configuration in String format (ALWAYS update configuration before return, maybe a move was executed).
        Returns:
        The configuration of the floppy cube using a single line (easier for computers and harder for humans).
        See Also:
        updateConfig()

      • resetConfig

        private void resetConfig()
        *USE WITH CAUTION* Set current cube configuration to an empty String.

      • updateConfig

        private void updateConfig()
        Update the current cube configuration (useful to execute after performing a cube move).
        See Also:
        resetConfig()

      • setStep

        public void setStep(int step)
        Sets the current step of the cube. (The initial configuration is considered step zero) If the step to be set is bigger than 8, an exception is thrown, because the maximum number of steps needed to solve the cube is 8 (i.e. algorithm God's number)
        Parameters:
        step - New step of the cube.

      • getStep

        public int getStep()
        Specified by:
        getStep in interface Solvable
        Returns:
        The current step of the cube. (The initial configuration is considered step zero)

      • swap

        private void swap(int i,
                  int j,
                  int k,
                  int l)
        Swaps one color of the cube position in the matrix, with another color of the cube. The first color position in the matrix is in row i and column j. The second color position in the matrix is in row k and column l. Please avoid swapping colors in the same position (i.e. i == k and j == l).
        Parameters:
        i - First color row number.
        j - First color column number.
        k - Second color column number.
        l - Second color column number.
        See Also:
        getCube()

      • leftVertical

        public void leftVertical()
        Move 180 degrees the left vertical lane of colors.
        See Also:
        swap(int, int, int, int)

        public void rightVertical()
        Move 180 degrees the right vertical lane of colors.

        public void midVertical()
        Move 180 degrees the middle vertical lane of colors.

      • upHorizontal

        public void upHorizontal()
        Move 180 degrees the top horizontal lane of colors.
        See Also:

      • isSolved

        public boolean isSolved()
        Check if cube is in final configuration, this means that upper face has all positions with the same color, this also applies to the lower face and sides of the cube.
        Specified by:
        isSolved in interface Solvable
        Returns:
        True if the cube is in the solved configuration, else false.
        See Also:
        updateConfig()

      • getSuccessors

        public java.util.List<Solvable> getSuccessors()
        Makes all the possible moves (creating new cubes), for the current configuration and adds them all to a list.
        Specified by:
        getSuccessors in interface Solvable
        Returns:
        List of every possible next move configuration.
        See Also:
        leftVertical(), midVertical(), rightVertical(), upHorizontal(), midHorizontal(), downHorizontal(), TCube(String, int)
